detailsOfAchievement: 1. Maharishi patanjali institute Shahpurkandi has been in the field of Naturopathy and Yoga since 2006.The reputed institution started its journey as MAHARISHI PATANJALI ISTITUTE to provide Education of Yoga/ Naturopathy and Ayush therapy to the underprivileged students of the rural, backward, hilly and kandi area of northern Punjab. 2. Dr.Vikesh Mahajan renowned Yog-Acharya, Physiotherapist, Naturopath, Acupuncturist, and social worker is the founder chairman of the Maharishi Patanjali Institute Of Naturopathy And Yoga. After serving the society in the field of education for about 5 years, the MPINY got registration from Punjab Government in the year 2011, under society registration act. 3. In the year 2011, The MPINY got registered as Maharishi Patanjali Institute Of Naturopathy And Yoga and in the same year to cater the Naturopathy ,Yoga & Ayush therapy Education needs of this backward region of Punjab it got affiliation from Mahatma Gandhi University to run Courses. 4. The Institute not only has worked in the field of education for rural youths but also for the issues of the social concern such as Tree Plantation , Organizing seminars to make people ,aware about Female Feticides, AIDS , Yoga and naturopathy , agaist drugs and in the promotion of alternative therapies. 5. The institute is organizing the camps to make yoga and naturopathy more popular and a way of life for last 10 years. 7. The program initiated a number of awareness and consultation sessions with advocates, doctors and women organizations.

detailsOfAchievement: Swami Vivekanand Medical Mission (Regd.) is working since past 40 years in the field of health conditions of the poor and weaker sections of the society. It started its first hospital in a remote locality of Islamabad, Amritsar in a single hired room at Chowk Rajputan in the year 1979. Presently, Five medical units namely Allopathic, Eyes, Dental, Physiotherapy and clinical laboratory, in a three storied building at 12- Makan (Islamabad) area of Amritsar, are attending around 200 patients daily.
